reproduction:
One day, there was a shifty woman who tried to sneak onto a plane.
I tell you, she probably had guns or knives or bombs with her
the way she was trying to get on it. Right before the plane takes
off, she would try to get herself onto the wheel so that she would
be able to sneak into the cargo hold. Why? I don't know but the
first time she did it, she got caught. She tried it again like
a week later. And she actually freaking got onto the plane! Nothing
happened at first, but once it touched down, a swarm of British
police surrounded the plane and checked out the passengers one
by one. Once they got to her, I wish I could tell you what they
found...but it's a secret.
story_text: A woman tried to sneak onto a flight twice. She succeeded the second time but was arrested by British customs upon landing.

reproduction:
Hey! Can you believe it? This 12 and 13 year old boy are going
to jail? Over killing some bees? They were out on a farm apparently,
in the afternoon playing ball with each other when one of them
felt a sting on his arm. He slapped at it..then felt another one.
And another one. There were like 20 stings before he finally saw
a swarm of bees buzzing around him. His friend saw that there
was a hive nearby and their games scared the bees. There was no
way they could run away from all the bees starting to swarm around
so they decided to be bosses and attack the hive instead. One
of them pulled out a lighter he had and the other took out a bottle
of RAID he stole from his house. I know. So weird to have that
on hand. But they opened the raid spray and hit the lighter and
that same time to make a freaking makeshift flamethrower! They
murked pretty much all the bees but there was a big uh-oh. That
bee hive was part of a bee farm that cost millions of dollars...and
they destroyed it. The owner found out pretty quick and the boys
are actually going to be arrested for this.
story_text: Two boys, one 12 and one 13 destroyed a bee farm costing millions of dollars. They will be fined and go to prision, but the farmer has lost his beloved bee farm.

story_text:
In the winter of 2017 two adolescent Iowa boys ages 12 and 13 destroyed 50 beehives.  These hives belonged to a couple who had invested quite a bit into their bees.  They lost $60,000 and tens of millions
of bees because of the boys.  Since the boys are juveniles they were given a slap on the wrist, fined, and sent to juvie.  Soon they will be free.

story_text:
In late December 2017, a couple in Iowa checked on their 50 beehives when they discovered a tragic incident. The hives had been overturned and hacked apart, the equipment had been thrown out of the shed
and smashed. This destruction caused the death of half a million bees and approximately $60,000 in property damage. Nearly three weeks later, two boys (12 and 13 years old) were arrested who are allegedly
responsible for the damage. The charges against them include criminal mischief, offenses to an agricultural animal facility, and burglary. Since they are still minors, they'll be charged in juvenile court
where they face up to 10 years in prison and fines up to $10,000 if convicted.

story_text:
January 15, 2018 a woman of 66 years old who did not have a ticket or passport went past the airport security in Chicago to London. She was able to enter the Chicago international airport on January 14.
She did this by hiding her face with her hair, and passing two transportation security officers who were checking other passenger tickets. When she was checked, she tried to board the plane to Connecticut
but failed. So she tried to sneak pass the officers, but was stopped. With no where to go, she stayed overnight at the airport and took a bus to the gate the next day. She got on the plane to Heathrow Airport
which is in London but was stopped any further by British officers. She got back to the US on January 18, and was charged with theft and misdemeanor.

story_text:
On January 15, 2018, a woman (66 years old) without a ticket and passport slipped through airport security and took a flight from Chicago to London. The woman entered Chicago O’Hare International Airport
on January 14. First, she hid her face with her hair and passed two Transportation Security Administration officers who were controlling other passenger’s boarding passes. After she was screened, she wanted
to board a flight to Connecticut but failed. When the woman tried to sneak past the gate agent, she was stopped and directed to sit down. She stayed overnight at the airport and rode a shuttle bus to the
international gate the next day, even though a passport and plane ticket are required to board the shuttle. She then entered a plane to Heathrow Airport (London), where she was detained by British customs
officials. She arrived back in the United States on January 18. The woman is charged with theft and misdemeanor for trespassing.

international gate the next day, even though a passport and plane ticket are required to board the shuttle. She then entered a plane to Heathrow Airport (London), where she was detained by British customs
officials. She arrived back in the United States on January 18. The woman is charged with theft and misdemeanor for trespassing.

reproduction: some kids killed some beehives and got in trouble
story_text:
In late December 2017, a couple in Iowa checked on their 50 beehives when they discovered a tragic incident. The hives had been overturned and hacked apart, the equipment had been thrown out of the shed
and smashed. This destruction caused the death of half a million bees and approximately $60,000 in property damage. Nearly three weeks later, two boys (12 and 13 years old) were arrested who are allegedly
responsible for the damage. The charges against them include criminal mischief, offenses to an agricultural animal facility, and burglary. Since they are still minors, they'll be charged in juvenile court
where they face up to 10 years in prison and fines up to $10,000 if convicted.
